de facto.translation[0].definitions[0].d: really existing although not legally stated to exist
de facto.translation[0].definitions[0].e: a de facto state of war
de facto.translation[1].definitions[0].d: really existing, even if there is no formal legal document etc to prove it
de facto.translation[1].definitions[0].e: Prior to the Companies Act 1976, resignation would have constituted a de facto breach of contract.
